reference.title: Elements of a JMS application
reference.shortdesc: This topic contains the different elements of a JMS messaging system.

section.p: A JMS application is composed of the following parts:

dlentry.dd: An application or process that produces messages, consumes messages or both.

Preconfigured JMS objects created by an administrator for the use of clients. The two kinds of JMS administered objects are destinations and connection factories. Destination The object a client uses to specify the target of messages it produces and the source of messages it consumes. The Destination implementation in the JMS client implements two destination interfaces:
Topic
Queue
Connection factory An object that a JMS client uses to create a connection with a JMS provider. The ConnectionFactory implementation in the JMS client implements the three connection factory interfaces:
ConnectionFactory
TopicConnectionFactory
QueueConnectionFactory
An object that contains the data being transferred between JMS clients.
A JMS client that creates and sends messages.
A JMS client that receives messages.

section.note: The function of queues is not implemented within the JMS client for the Beta release.
